canonical_explanation.text: Capacity tells us how much a container can hold. Some containers hold more and some hold less. When a container has nothing inside, it is empty. When it is filled to the top, it is full. When it is filled halfway, it is half-full. We can compare two containers by pouring water from one into the other. We can also measure how much a container holds by using small cups or spoons. For example, a jug may hold 5 cups of water and a bucket may hold 10 cups of water. The bucket holds more than the jug.
rules: Capacity means how much a container can hold inside it.
Full means the container is filled to the top.
Empty means the container has nothing inside.
Half-full means the container is filled halfway.
We compare capacity using words: more, less, or equal.
We can pour from one container into another to compare which holds more.
We can use non-standard units like cups and spoons to measure capacity.
A container that needs more cups to fill holds more water.

questions.question_text: What does 'full' mean?

options.text: The container is filled to the top

questions.explanation_correct: When a container is 'full', it means the container is filled to the top, with no empty space left inside. This is option B, which is the correct answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option B is the correct answer. When a container is 'full', it means it is filled to the top and has no empty space inside. Option A, 'the container has nothing inside', is incorrect because a full container has water or other contents filling it up. Option C, 'the container is filled halfway', is also incorrect because a full container is completely filled, not just halfway. Option D, 'the container has a hole', is not related to the meaning of 'full'.

questions.question_text: What does 'empty' mean?

options.text: The container is filled to the top

questions.explanation_correct: When a container is 'empty', it means the container has nothing inside. There is no water, no toys, no objects - the container is completely empty.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. 'Filled to the top' means the container is 'full', 'filled halfway' means the container is 'half-full', and 'very big' is not related to whether the container is empty or not. Only option C, 'the container has nothing inside', correctly describes what it means for a container to be 'empty'.

questions.question_text: A glass has water up to the middle. The glass is:
questions.explanation_correct: The glass is half-full because the water level is up to the middle of the glass. This means the glass is filled halfway, so it is half-full.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The glass is not full because the water level is not up to the top. It is also not empty, because there is water in the glass. The glass is also not overflowing, because the water level is not above the top of the glass. The correct answer is that the glass is half-full.

questions.question_text: A bucket is big and a cup is small. Which holds more water?
questions.explanation_correct: The bucket holds more water than the cup because the bucket is bigger. The bucket can hold a lot of water, while the cup can only hold a little water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cup does not hold more water than the bucket. The bucket is much bigger than the cup, so it can hold more water. Even if you fill the cup many times, the bucket will still hold more water than the cup.

questions.question_text: Which word means a container can hold less water than another?
questions.explanation_correct: The word 'less' means that a container can hold or contain a smaller amount of water compared to another container. This is the correct answer because it describes a container having a lower capacity or holding less water than another container.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The word 'more' means that a container can hold or contain a larger amount of water compared to another container. This is not the correct answer because it describes a container having a higher capacity or holding more water than another container. The word 'full' means that a container is completely filled and cannot hold any more water. The word 'empty' means that a container has no water in it at all.

questions.question_text: Riya fills a jug using a small cup. She pours 4 cups of water to fill the jug. What did she use to measure?
questions.explanation_correct: Riya used a small cup to measure the water and fill the jug. The question says she poured 4 cups of water, so she used a cup to measure the amount.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Riya did not use a ruler, scale, or clock to measure the water. These are used to measure things like length, weight, and time, but not volume or capacity. She used a cup, which is the correct tool to measure how much water can fit in the jug.

questions.question_text: A pot needs 6 cups of water to fill it. A bowl needs 3 cups. Which holds more?
questions.explanation_correct: The pot needs 6 cups of water to fill it, which is more than the 3 cups needed for the bowl. This means the pot holds more water than the bowl.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The bowl needs 3 cups of water, while the pot needs 6 cups. This means the pot holds more water than the bowl. The pot is the bigger container, so it can hold more water.

questions.question_text: Aman pours all the water from a small bottle into a big bottle. The big bottle is not yet full. What does this tell us?
questions.explanation_correct: The big bottle holds more than the small bottle. Since the big bottle is not yet full after Aman pours all the water from the small bottle, it means the big bottle can hold more water than the small bottle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The small bottle does not hold more water than the big bottle. If Aman poured all the water from the small bottle into the big bottle and the big bottle is still not full, it means the big bottle can hold more water than the small bottle. The big bottle holds more capacity than the small bottle.

questions.question_text: A water bottle is full. You drink some water. Now the bottle is:
questions.explanation_correct: The water bottle is not full anymore because you drank some of the water, so the amount of water in the bottle has decreased.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The water bottle is not still full because you drank some of the water. It is also not overflowing, as the water level is lower than the top of the bottle. The water bottle is not bigger either, as its size has not changed.

questions.question_text: A mug holds 3 spoons of water. A jug holds 9 spoons of water. How many times do you need to fill the mug to fill the jug?
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is B) 3 times. This is because the mug holds 3 spoons of water, and the jug holds 9 spoons of water. To fill the jug, you need to fill the mug 3 times, since 3 mug-fulls will equal 9 spoons, which is the amount the jug can hold.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not A) 2 times, C) 6 times, or D) 9 times. This is because the mug holds 3 spoons of water, and the jug holds 9 spoons of water. To fill the jug, you need to fill the mug 3 times, since 3 mug-fulls will equal 9 spoons, which is the amount the jug can hold.

questions.question_text: Two glasses are the same size. One is full of juice and one is half-full of juice. Which glass has more juice?
questions.explanation_correct: The full glass has more juice because it is filled all the way to the top, while the half-full glass only has half as much juice.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The half-full glass does not have more juice than the full glass. When a container is full, it holds the maximum amount of liquid it can hold. Even though the half-full glass is not completely filled, the full glass has more juice inside it.

questions.question_text: Which of these can you use to measure how much water a bottle holds?
questions.explanation_correct: You can use a cup to measure how much water a bottle holds. A cup is a small container that can be used to measure the amount of liquid in a larger container like a bottle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You cannot use a pencil, rope, or crayon to measure how much water a bottle holds. These are not containers, so they cannot be used to measure the amount of liquid. You need to use a cup or another small container to measure the amount of water in a bottle.

questions.question_text: You pour water from Bottle A into Bottle B. Bottle B becomes full and there is still water left in Bottle A. Which bottle holds less?
questions.explanation_correct: Bottle B must be the one that holds less, because even after Bottle B became full, there was still water left in Bottle A. This means Bottle B could not hold as much water as Bottle A.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bottle A does not hold less than Bottle B. The question tells us that after pouring water from Bottle A into Bottle B, Bottle B became full and there was still water left in Bottle A. This means Bottle A must hold more than Bottle B. Both bottles cannot hold the same amount, because then Bottle B would not have become full after pouring from Bottle A.

questions.question_text: Container X takes 5 cups to fill. Container Y takes 5 cups to fill. What can you say?

options.text: X and Y hold the same amount

questions.explanation_correct: If container X and container Y both take 5 cups to fill, then they hold the same amount. This means they have the same capacity, or can hold the same volume of liquid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The question tells us that both container X and container Y take 5 cups to fill. This means they can both hold the same amount, so X does not hold more than Y, and Y does not hold more than X. The correct answer is that X and Y hold the same amount.

questions.question_text: Mum fills a glass to the top with milk. Then she pours out half the milk. The glass is now:
questions.explanation_correct: The glass is now half-full because Mum poured out half the milk that was filling the glass to the top. So the glass is now half-full of milk.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The glass is not full anymore because Mum poured out half the milk. It is also not empty, as there is still half the milk left in the glass. The glass is now half-full, not overflowing.

questions.question_text: A container with nothing inside it is called ___.
questions.explanation_correct: When a container has nothing inside it, it is called 'empty'. This means the container is completely free from anything, like water or other objects. An empty container has no contents inside it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'empty'. A container with nothing inside it is the opposite of being 'full'. When a container is empty, it means there is no water, toys, or anything else inside it. The container is completely free of any contents.

questions.question_text: A container filled to the top is called ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A container that is filled all the way up to the top is called 'full'. This means there is no empty space left inside the container, and it is completely filled with whatever is inside it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'full'. A container that is filled to the top, with no empty space left inside, is called 'full'. It is not called 'empty' or 'half-full' when it is completely filled to the top.

questions.question_text: A bottle that has water up to the middle is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The bottle is half-full because the water inside the bottle is up to the middle, which means it is filled halfway. This is the definition of 'half-full'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'half-full'. When a container is filled up to the middle, it is considered half-full. This means the container is not completely empty, nor is it completely full. It is in between, or halfway filled.

questions.question_text: A swimming pool holds ___ water than a bucket. (more/less)
questions.explanation_correct: A swimming pool holds more water than a bucket because a swimming pool is very big and can hold a lot of water, much more than a smaller container like a bucket.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is 'more'. A swimming pool is a very large container that can hold a lot more water than a small bucket. The swimming pool holds more water than the bucket.

questions.question_text: A spoon holds ___ water than a jug. (more/less)
questions.explanation_correct: A spoon holds less water than a jug. This is because a jug is a bigger container that can hold more water than a small spoon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is 'less'. A spoon is a small container that holds less water than a bigger jug. The question is asking to compare the capacity or amount of water that a spoon and a jug can hold, and a spoon holds 'less' water than a jug.

questions.question_text: A bowl takes 4 cups of water to fill. A pot takes 7 cups. The pot holds ___ water than the bowl.
questions.explanation_correct: The pot holds more water than the bowl because it can hold 7 cups of water, while the bowl can only hold 4 cups. Since the pot holds a larger amount, it is said to hold more water than the bowl.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is 'more' because the pot can hold 7 cups of water, which is more than the 4 cups the bowl can hold. Even though the bowl and the pot are both containers that can hold water, the pot has a larger capacity, so it holds more water than the bowl.

questions.question_text: Jar A needs 6 spoons of water to fill. Jar B needs 2 spoons. Jar B holds ___ water than Jar A.
questions.explanation_correct: Jar B needs 2 spoons of water to fill, which is less than the 6 spoons needed to fill Jar A. This means Jar B holds less water than Jar A.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Jar B does not hold more water than Jar A. Since Jar B needs only 2 spoons of water to fill, and Jar A needs 6 spoons, Jar B holds less water than Jar A. The correct answer is 'less'.

questions.question_text: A bucket needs 8 cups of water to fill. A tank needs 8 cups of water to fill. They hold an ___ amount of water.
questions.explanation_correct: The bucket and the tank hold the same amount of water, 8 cups each, so they hold an equal amount of water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The question says that a bucket needs 8 cups of water to fill and a tank also needs 8 cups of water to fill. This means that they hold the same, or equal, amount of water. The correct answer is 'equal'.

questions.question_text: You pour all the water from a full glass into a bowl. The bowl is not yet full. The bowl can hold ___ water than the glass.
questions.explanation_correct: The bowl can hold more water than the glass because the bowl is bigger and can fit more water than the full glass. When you pour all the water from the glass into the bowl, the bowl is not yet full, which means it can hold more water than the glass.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is 'more'. This is because the bowl is bigger than the glass, so it can hold more water than the full glass. When you pour all the water from the glass into the bowl, the bowl is not yet full, which shows that the bowl can hold a larger amount of water compared to the glass.

questions.question_text: A jug is full of water. You pour out all the water. Now the jug is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: When a jug is full of water and you pour out all the water, the jug becomes empty. There is no more water left in the jug, so it is now empty.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'empty'. If a jug is full of water and you pour out all the water, the jug will have no water left in it. It will be an empty container, with nothing inside. The jug is not full, half-full, or anything else - it is completely empty.

questions.question_text: A glass filled to the top with juice is called full.
questions.explanation_correct: A glass filled to the top with juice is called full because it is completely filled and cannot hold any more liquid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A glass filled to the top with juice is not called empty. When a container is filled to the top, it is called full. This means it cannot hold any more liquid. If the glass was only half-filled, it would be called half-full.

questions.question_text: An empty bottle has water inside it.
questions.explanation_correct: An empty bottle has no water inside it. When a container is empty, it means there is nothing in it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If a bottle has water inside it, then it is not empty. An empty bottle is a container that has nothing in it. It does not have any water or other liquid inside.

questions.question_text: Half-full means the container has water up to the middle.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, that's correct! When a container is half-full, it means the water or other liquid inside reaches the middle of the container, not all the way to the top.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, that's not correct. Half-full means the container is filled up to the middle, not all the way to the top. If the container is full, it means the water or liquid reaches the very top of the container.

questions.question_text: A bathtub holds more water than a teacup.
questions.explanation_correct: A bathtub is much bigger than a teacup, so it can hold a lot more water. A bathtub is used for taking a bath, while a teacup is used for drinking tea. The bathtub can hold much more water than the teacup.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A teacup is very small, and it can only hold a little bit of water. But a bathtub is very big, and it can hold a lot of water. The bathtub can hold much more water than the teacup, so the statement is true.

questions.question_text: A spoon holds more water than a bucket.
questions.explanation_correct: A spoon holds a small amount of water, while a bucket can hold a lot of water. So, a bucket holds more water than a spoon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A spoon is a small container that can only hold a little bit of water. A bucket is a big container that can hold a lot of water. So, the bucket holds more water than the spoon. The statement that a spoon holds more water than a bucket is not true.

questions.question_text: A jar takes 5 cups to fill. A pot takes 3 cups to fill. The pot holds more water than the jar.
questions.explanation_correct: The jar takes 5 cups to fill, while the pot takes only 3 cups to fill. This means the jar holds more water than the pot, so the statement is false.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false because the jar takes 5 cups to fill, but the pot only takes 3 cups to fill. This means the jar holds more water than the pot, not the other way around. The pot does not hold more water than the jar.

questions.question_text: If two containers both take 4 cups to fill, they hold the same amount of water.
questions.explanation_correct: If two containers both need 4 cups to fill them up, then they hold the same amount of water. This means they have the same capacity or volume, even if they are different shapes and sizes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If the two containers take different amounts of cups to fill, then they do not hold the same amount of water. For example, if one container takes 4 cups to fill and the other takes 5 cups to fill, then the second container holds more water than the first one.

questions.question_text: You pour water from a full jug into a bowl. The bowl overflows. This means the jug holds more water than the bowl.
questions.explanation_correct: The jug holds more water than the bowl. When you pour the water from the full jug into the bowl, the bowl overflows, which means it cannot hold all the water from the jug. This shows that the jug holds more water than the bowl.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If the bowl overflows, it means the jug holds more water than the bowl can hold. The bowl is not able to hold all the water from the full jug, so the water spills out. This shows that the jug holds more water than the bowl, not the other way around.

questions.question_text: A glass that is half-full has more water than the same glass when it is full.
questions.explanation_correct: When a glass is half-full, it has only half the amount of water that it can hold when it is full. So a half-full glass has less water than a full glass.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If a glass is half-full, it has only 50% of the water that the same full glass can hold. A full glass has the most water it can hold, so it has more water than a half-full glass of the same size.

questions.question_text: We can use cups and spoons to find out how much a container holds.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, that's true. We can use small cups and spoons to measure how much a container like a jug or bucket can hold. This helps us compare which container holds more.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, that's not correct. We cannot use cups and spoons to find out how much a container holds. We need to pour the contents of the container into smaller cups or spoons to measure its capacity or volume.

questions.question_text: Arrange these containers from the one that holds the least to the one that holds the most.
questions.explanation_correct: The spoon holds the least, the cup holds more than the spoon, the bucket holds more than the cup, and the bathtub holds the most. This is the correct order from the container that holds the least to the one that holds the most.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to put the bucket first, as it is the largest container. However, the spoon is actually the container that holds the least, followed by the cup, then the bucket, and finally the bathtub, which holds the most. The order should be from the smallest to the largest container.

questions.question_text: Arrange from the one that holds the most to the one that holds the least.
questions.explanation_correct: The swimming pool holds the most, followed by the jug, then the bowl, and the teacup holds the least. This is because the swimming pool is the largest container, then the jug, the bowl, and the teacup is the smallest container.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: teacup, bowl, jug, swimming pool. This is not correct because the teacup is the smallest container and holds the least, the bowl is larger than the teacup, the jug is larger than the bowl, and the swimming pool is the largest container and holds the most.

questions.question_text: These containers were measured using cups. Arrange from least capacity to most capacity: Pot (8 cups), Jar (3 cups), Bowl (5 cups), Mug (2 cups).
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is correct because the containers are arranged from the one that holds the least amount (Mug with 2 cups) to the one that holds the most amount (Pot with 8 cups). The order is Mug, Jar, Bowl, and then Pot, which matches the capacity of each container in increasing order.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be to arrange the containers in a different order, like putting the Jar (3 cups) before the Mug (2 cups), or putting the Bowl (5 cups) before the Jar (3 cups). The correct order is Mug, Jar, Bowl, Pot because this matches the capacity of each container from the smallest to the largest.

questions.question_text: Arrange these containers from the most capacity to the least. Container A: 10 spoons, Container B: 4 spoons, Container C: 7 spoons, Container D: 1 spoon.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is correct because Container A holds the most with 10 spoons, Container C holds the second most with 7 spoons, Container B holds the third most with 4 spoons, and Container D holds the least with 1 spoon. We arranged the containers from the most capacity to the least.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct order from the most capacity to the least is: Container A (10 spoons), Container C (7 spoons), Container B (4 spoons), and Container D (1 spoon). This is because the bigger the number of spoons a container can hold, the more it can hold. So the container with 10 spoons holds the most, the one with 7 spoons holds the second most, and so on.

questions.question_text: Arrange these glasses from the least water to the most water: Full glass, Empty glass, Half-full glass.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Empty glass, Half-full glass, Full glass. This is because an empty glass has the least water, a half-full glass has more water than an empty one, and a full glass has the most water of the three.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Full glass, Half-full glass, Empty glass. This is wrong because an empty glass has the least water, a half-full glass has more water than an empty one, and a full glass has the most water. The order should be from the container with the least water to the one with the most water.

questions.question_text: Arrange these containers from least to most capacity: Bottle (6 cups), Tank (12 cups), Glass (1 cup), Jug (4 cups).
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is correct because the containers are arranged from the one that holds the least amount (Glass - 1 cup) to the one that holds the most amount (Tank - 12 cups). This shows the containers in order from the smallest capacity to the largest capacity.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is not in the order from least to most capacity. The order should be: Glass (1 cup), Jug (4 cups), Bottle (6 cups), Tank (12 cups). This shows the containers arranged from the smallest capacity to the largest capacity.

questions.question_text: Arrange from the container that holds the most to the one that holds the least: Mug, Pond, Bucket, Spoon.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from the container that holds the most to the one that holds the least is: Pond, Bucket, Mug, Spoon. This is because a pond can hold the most water, followed by a bucket, then a mug, and finally a spoon which holds the least amount of water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Bucket, Mug, Spoon, Pond. This is wrong because a pond can hold much more water than a bucket, which is smaller than a pond. Also, a spoon holds less water than a mug, so the order should be from largest to smallest container.

questions.question_text: What is the the correct word of A glass filled to the top?
questions.explanation_correct: A glass that is filled to the top is called 'full'. This means it has the maximum amount of liquid that it can hold inside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. 'Nearly full' means the glass is almost full but not completely. 'Empty' means the glass has no liquid inside. 'Half-full' means the glass is filled only halfway, not all the way to the top. A glass that is filled to the very top is the correct answer, which is 'full'.

questions.question_text: What is the the correct word of A glass with nothing inside?
questions.explanation_correct: A glass with nothing inside is empty. This means the glass is completely free of any liquid or object. The correct word to describe this is 'empty'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A glass that is 'nearly full' means it has a lot of liquid inside, but not completely filled to the top. A glass that is 'half-full' means it is filled halfway. A glass that is 'full' means it is completely filled to the top. However, a glass with nothing inside it is empty, which is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: What is the the correct word of A glass with water up to the middle?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct word for a glass with water up to the middle is 'half-full'. This means the glass is filled up to half its capacity, not completely full.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The glass is not 'nearly full' because it is only filled up to half its capacity. It is also not 'full' because it is not completely filled to the top. It is definitely not 'empty' because there is water in the glass. The correct answer is 'half-full' because the glass is filled up to the middle, or half, of its total capacity.

questions.question_text: What is the the correct word of A glass with water almost to the top?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 'Nearly full' because the glass has water almost to the top, but not completely full.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The glass is not 'Full' because it does not have water all the way to the top. It is also not 'Half-full' because the water level is higher than halfway. The glass is also not 'Empty' because it has water in it. 'Nearly full' is the best answer because the glass has water almost to the top.

questions.question_text: What is the whether it holds more or less water of Bucket?
questions.explanation_correct: The bucket holds more water than the jug. The question says that a bucket can hold 10 cups of water, while a jug can only hold 5 cups. So the bucket holds more water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The bucket does not hold less water. The question tells us that the bucket can hold 10 cups of water, which is more than the 5 cups that the jug can hold. The bucket is a bigger container, so it can hold more water inside it.

questions.question_text: What is the whether it holds more or less water of Spoon?
questions.explanation_correct: A spoon holds less water than a bigger container like a bucket or a jug. Spoons are small and can only hold a little bit of water, while buckets and jugs can hold a lot more water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A spoon actually holds less water than a bigger container. Spoons are small and can only hold a little bit of water, while buckets and jugs can hold a lot more. This is because a spoon is a small container, so it can't hold as much water as a bigger container like a bucket or a jug.

questions.question_text: What is the whether it holds more or less water of Bathtub?
questions.explanation_correct: The bathtub holds more water than other smaller containers like cups or bowls. This is because a bathtub is a large container that can hold a lot of water, much more than a small cup or bowl.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bathtub is a very large container that can hold a lot of water. It holds much more water than smaller containers like cups or bowls. This is because a bathtub is designed to be a big container to fit a person inside, so it can hold a lot more water compared to smaller containers.

questions.question_text: What is the whether it holds more or less water of Teacup?
questions.explanation_correct: A teacup holds less water than a bucket. Teacups are smaller containers that can't hold as much water as bigger containers like buckets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bucket holds more water than a teacup. Buckets are larger containers that can hold a lot more water than smaller containers like teacups. The teacup holds less water because it is a smaller container.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Small bowl (holds the least)?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 2 cups because a small bowl holds the least amount of liquid compared to the other options given.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer is A) 3 cups. A small bowl holds less than 3 cups, which is the least amount of liquid compared to the other options given. The correct answer is C) 2 cups because a small bowl is the container that holds the smallest or least amount of liquid.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Medium jar?
questions.explanation_correct: A medium jar holds 5 cups of water, which is the correct answer. This is because the question is asking about the value or capacity of a medium jar, and the information provided earlier says that a medium jar holds 5 cups of water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 5 cups. This is because the question is asking about the capacity of a medium jar, and the information given earlier states that a medium jar holds 5 cups of water. The other options, like 3 cups, 2 cups, and 10 cups, are incorrect because they do not match the capacity of a medium jar.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Big pot (holds the most)?
questions.explanation_correct: The big pot holds the most, which is 10 cups. This is because bigger containers can hold more than smaller containers like 3 cups or 2 cups.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 10 cups. The big pot is the largest container, so it can hold the most water compared to the other options. 3 cups and 2 cups are much smaller, so they cannot hold as much as the big pot that holds 10 cups.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Mug?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of a Mug is 3 cups. This is because a Mug is a smaller container compared to a Jug or Bucket, and it can hold less water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The value of a Mug is not 10 cups, 5 cups, or 2 cups. A Mug is a smaller container than a Jug or Bucket, and it can hold 3 cups of water. This means the Mug has a capacity of 3 cups, which is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: What is the the correct comparison of Bucket and cup?
questions.explanation_correct: The bucket holds more than the cup because it is a larger container. The question tells us that a bucket can hold 10 cups of water, while a jug can hold only 5 cups. So the bucket holds more than the cup.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The options 'Tank holds more' and 'Bowl holds more' are incorrect because the question is comparing a bucket and a cup. The option 'Both hold equal' is also incorrect because the information given tells us that the bucket holds more (10 cups) than the cup (5 cups).

questions.question_text: What is the result of Pour out all the water from a full glass?
questions.explanation_correct: When you pour out all the water from a full glass, the glass becomes empty. This is because you have removed all the water from the glass, leaving it with nothing inside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If you pour out all the water from a full glass, the glass does not become full or half-full. It becomes empty because you have removed all the water from the glass. The correct answer is that the glass becomes empty.

questions.question_text: What is the result of Fill an empty glass to the top?
questions.explanation_correct: If you fill an empty glass to the top, the glass becomes full. This is because the glass is completely filled with liquid and there is no more space left inside the glass.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If you fill an empty glass to the top, the glass does not become half-full or empty. When you fill a glass to the top, it becomes full and cannot hold any more liquid. The correct answer is that the glass becomes full.

questions.question_text: What is the result of Fill an empty glass halfway?
questions.explanation_correct: When you fill an empty glass halfway, it becomes half-full. This means the glass is filled with water up to the middle, not all the way to the top.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Filling an empty glass all the way to the top would make it full, not half-full. Half-full means the glass is filled only halfway, with half the space still empty.

questions.question_text: What is the result of Add more water to a half-full glass until the top?
questions.explanation_correct: If the glass is half-full, and you add more water to it, the glass will become full. This is because you are adding more water until the glass is completely filled to the top.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If the glass is half-full, and you add more water to it, the glass will not become empty. The glass will become full because you are filling it up with more water until it is completely full. The glass will not be half-full anymore, it will be full.

questions.question_text: What is the the correct word of A jug holds a bigger amount than a cup?

questions.question_text: What is the the correct word of Two same bottles hold the same amount?

questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'equal', not 'less' or 'more'. If two bottles are the same size, they can hold the same amount of liquid, so the amount is equal. 'Less' and 'more' are not the correct words to describe this situation.

questions.question_text: What is the the correct word of A tank holds a bigger amount than a bucket?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct word is 'more' because a tank holds a bigger amount or volume of liquid than a bucket. Tanks are usually larger containers that can hold more than smaller containers like buckets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The word 'less' is incorrect because a tank holds a bigger amount than a bucket.
